channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump, Zelenskyy to meet Sunday, as Ukrainian leader vows country will 'do whatever it takes' to end war
item.description: President Donald Trump will host Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy at Mar-a-Lago Sunday in an effort to end the Ukraine war.

item.title: 'Unlucky' Honduran woman arrested after allegedly running red light and crashing into ICE vehicle
item.description: Federal agents arrest woman who allegedly crashed into ICE vehicle in Slidell, Louisiana, as part of Operation Catahoula targeting illegal immigrants ...

item.title: NASA’s upcoming moonshot may let astronauts be the first to lay eyes on parts of the lunar far side that were missed by the Apollo program
item.description: Launching early in the year, the three Americans and one Canadian will zip past the moon, do a U-turn behind it, then hustle straight back to Earth.

item.title: Elon Musk warns 'people will die' over Mamdani's FDNY commissioner pick, Lillian Bonsignore
item.description: NYC Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani appointed Lillian Bonsignore as FDNY commissioner, and Elon Musk criticized her qualifications and background.

item.title: Mixed Vaccine Messages Threaten Trump’s Agenda and Republicans’ Electoral Outlook
item.description: Polls show that strong majorities of voters — including Trump supporters — think vaccines are forces for good.

item.title: Ahead of meeting with Trump, Zelenskyy says ‘Ukraine is willing to do whatever it takes to stop this war’
item.description: Zelenskyy said the two planned to discuss security and economic agreements and he will raise “territorial issues.”

item.title: Snowflake CEO: Big Tech’s grip on AI will loosen in 2026 — plus 6 more predictions that will define the year
item.description: The real AI race is starting now, and the organizations that lead in 2026 won't be those with the most AI pilots or the biggest technology budgets.

item.title: Bring Back Snow Days

item.title: France’s Populist Surge Is a Cautionary Tale for America’s Right
item.description: Populism can win elections, but without fiscal discipline, it risks perpetuating the very welfare bloat it rails against.
